identificationModule.briefTitle: Evaluation of a Telehealth Oncofertility Care Intervention in Adolescent and Young Adult Cancer Patients
identificationModule.officialTitle: Evaluation of a Telehealth Oncofertility Care Intervention in Adolescent and Young Adult Cancer Patients: a Stepped Wedge Cluster Randomized Controlled Trial

descriptionModule.briefSummary: The purpose of this study is to evaluate the effectiveness of a multi-component intervention to improve young cancer survivors' engagement in goal-concordant oncofertility care, concurrently with observing and gathering information on how the intervention is implemented. The investigators hypothesize that implementation of the intervention will result in increased young cancer survivors' engagement in goal-concordant oncofertility care.

designInfo.interventionModelDescription: Stepped wedge cluster randomized controlled trial

maskingInfo.maskingDescription: Fertility specialists and their support staff will be blinded to the intervention status of the cluster from which a patient is referred to minimize differences in counseling in patients whom they expect to receive financial navigation.

armGroups.label: Multi-component oncofertility care intervention
armGroups.description: Eligible cancer patients presenting to oncology clinical visits will receive care through the multi-component oncofertility care intervention.

armGroups.label: Usual Care
armGroups.description: Eligible cancer patients presenting to oncology clinical visits will receive usual care.

interventions.name: Multi-component oncofertility care intervention
interventions.description: The multi-component oncofertility care intervention includes: (1) an adaptive and smart default electronic health record-based oncofertility needs screen and referral pathway, (2) telehealth oncofertility counseling as indicated, and (3) telehealth oncofertility financial navigation as indicated.

primaryOutcomes.measure: Number of reproductive-aged female and male patients (aged 12 to 39 years) who engage in goal-concordant oncofertility care
primaryOutcomes.description: The proportion of eligible reproductive-aged male and female patients (aged 12 to 39 years) who engage in oncofertility services (1\| an oncofertility needs screen, 2\| referral to oncofertility consult, 3\| oncofertility consult, and/or 4\| fertility preservation services) that meet the patient's individual needs will be abstracted from medical records using standardized case report forms.

The 16-item Decisional Conflict Scale (DCS) will be used to measure patients' decisional conflict for engaging in fertility preservation services. The DCS consists of 16 statements with 5 response options (ranging from strongly agree to strongly disagree) that measures the patient's perceptions of uncertainty in choosing options, feeling informed, values clarity, support in decision making, and effective decision making. The DCS total score will be dichotomized at 37.5 (scale 0-100; \> 37.5 indicates high decisional conflict).

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Number of female (aged 0 to 42 years) and male (aged 0 to 50 years) patients who engage in goal-concordant oncofertility care
secondaryOutcomes.description: The proportion of eligible female and male patients (aged 0 to 42 years for females; 0 to 50 years for males) who engage in oncofertility services \[1) an oncofertility needs screen, 2) referral to oncofertility consult, 3) oncofertility consult, and/or 4) fertility preservation services\] that meet the patient's individual needs will be abstracted from medical records using standardized case report forms.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Number of female patients (aged 0 to 42 years) who engage in goal-concordant oncofertility care
secondaryOutcomes.description: The proportion of eligible female patients (aged 0 to 42 years) who engage in oncofertility services \[1) an oncofertility needs screen, 2) referral to oncofertility consult, 3) oncofertility consult, and/or 4) fertility preservation services\] that meet the patient's individual needs will be abstracted from medical records using standardized case report forms.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Number of male patients (aged 0 to 50 years) who engage in goal-concordant oncofertility care
secondaryOutcomes.description: The proportion of eligible male patients (aged 0 to 50 years) who engage in oncofertility services \[1) an oncofertility needs screen, 2) referral to oncofertility consult, 3) oncofertility consult, and/or 4) fertility preservation services\] that meet the patient's individual needs will be abstracted from medical records using standardized case report forms.

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* Newly diagnosed cancer or cancer relapse
* Primary language English or Spanish
* Receiving oncology care at participating clinical sites
* Ages 0 to 42 years if female
* Ages 0 to 50 years if male

Exclusion Criteria:

* Non-melanoma skin cancer, because primary treatment is excision with no infertility risk
* Metastatic/Stage IV non-thyroid solid tumors, because of poor prognosis

locations.facility: Cancer Resource Center of the Desert

ipdSharingStatementModule.description: Deidentified individual participant data generated during the study will be available from the principal investigator (H. Irene Su) upon reasonable request.
ipdSharingStatementModule.timeFrame: Requests for deidentified individual participant data can be made beginning 12 months after publication and for up to 36 months post publication.
ipdSharingStatementModule.accessCriteria: Deidentified individual participant data reported in the manuscript will be shared under the terms of a Data Use Agreement and may only be used for approved proposals. Requests may be made to the principal investigator (H. Irene Su).
